metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39347 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affectedversions of FreeRDP are missing path canonicalization and base path checkfor `drive` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client toread files outside the shared directory. This issue has been addressed inversion 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgradeshould not use the `/drive`, `/drives` or `+home-drive` redirection switch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
freerdp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
